meanings.definition: The quality of being expressive or capable of conveying emotion or meaning.
meanings.sent1: Her face showed great expressivity as she performed on stage.
meanings.sent2: The artist's painting was full of expressivity, capturing the essence of the sunset.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's tail wagging with expressivity made everyone in the room smile.
meanings.sent4: The expressivity of the music touched the hearts of all who listened.
meanings.sent5: The actor's expressivity brought the character to life on screen.

meanings.definition: The degree to which a person or thing is able to communicate effectively or convey information.
meanings.sent1: The expressivity of the speaker captivated the audience's attention.
meanings.sent2: The expressivity of the data visualization made it easy to understand the trends.
meanings.sent3: The expressivity of the robot's movements made it seem almost human.
meanings.sent4: The expressivity of the colors in the painting spoke volumes without words.
meanings.sent5: The expressivity of the gesture conveyed more than words ever could.
